Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_name: VG2 NEP CRS RESAMPLED SUMMARY D2 RATE ELEC 96SEC V1.0
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: VG2 NEP CRS RESAMPLED SUMMARY D2 RATE ELEC 96SEC V1.0
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: Counting rate from the D2 detector in the Cosmic Ray System (CRS) electron telescope (TET) on Voyager 2 during the Neptune encounter. The D2 detector nominally responds to electrons with kinetic energies above approximately 2.5 MeV.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data Set Overview ================= Counting rate from the D2 detector in the Cosmic Ray System (CRS) electron telescope (TET) on Voyager 2 during the Neptune encounter. The D2 detector nominally responds to electrons with kinetic energies above approximately 2.5 MeV.
Processing Level Id : 4 Software Flag : N Processing Start Time : UNK Processing Stop Time : UNK
Parameters ==========
Data Set Parameter 'D2 RATE' ---------------------------- The D2 detector is located behind the D1 detector in the TET telescope, so that most of the electrons observed by D2 have to penetrate D1 first. The D2 rate therefore applies to higher energy electrons and the threshold energy is less distinct than for D1, but is near 2.5 MeV. The rate can be calculated from the electron differential flux in the same way as the D1 RATE (see D1 RATE description) with the following calibration table.
D2 response function:
| 11. 23. 41. 61. ________|___________________________ | 0.989 | 0.000 0.000 0.000 0.001 1.179 | 0.000 0.000 0.000 0.013 1.372 | 0.000 0.000 0.000 0.037 1.567 | 0.000 0.019 0.028 0.063 1.763 | 0.041 0.034 0.045 0.090 1.959 | 0.106 0.078 0.072 0.119 2.157 | 0.255 0.186 0.127 0.152 2.355 | 0.488 0.381 0.228 0.206 2.553 | 0.772 0.627 0.361 0.272 2.752 | 1.019 0.864 0.501 0.340 2.951 | 1.220 1.053 0.634 0.400 3.150 | 1.461 1.218 0.746 0.459 3.350 | 1.628 1.378 0.940 0.515
________|_____________________ | 80. 90. 100. ________|_____________________ | 0.989 | 0.002 0.001 0.001 1.179 | 0.023 0.021 0.018 1.372 | 0.052 0.051 0.043 1.567 | 0.082 0.066 0.061 1.763 | 0.111 0.098 0.080 1.959 | 0.142 0.125 0.097 2.157 | 0.170 0.146 0.109 2.355 | 0.212 0.176 0.126 2.553 | 0.255 0.202 0.139 2.752 | 0.299 0.226 0.152 2.951 | 0.335 0.250 0.165 3.150 | 0.375 0.289 0.188 3.350 | 0.456 0.411 0.282
Sampling Parameter Name : TIME Data Set Parameter Name : D2 RATE Sampling Parameter Resolution : 6.000000 Sampling Parameter Interval : 96.000000 Minimum Available Sampling Int : 96.000000 Data Set Parameter Unit : COUNTS/SECOND Noise Level : 0.000000 Sampling Parameter Unit : SECOND
Source Instrument Parameters ============================ Instrument Host ID : VG2 Data Set Parameter Name : D2 RATE Instrument Parameter Name : D2 RATE Important Instrument Parameters : 1
Processing ==========
Processing History ------------------ Source Data Set ID : N/A Software : ENCYCLOPEDIA GENERATOR Product Data Set ID : VG2-N-CRS-4-SUMM-D2-96SEC-V1.0
Source Data Set ID : N/A Software : VCRUSH Product Data Set ID : VG2-N-CRS-4-SUMM-D2-96SEC-V1.0
Software 'ENCYCLOPEDIA GENERATOR' --------------------------------- This program is run by Nand Lal at Goddard Space Flight Center. It reads the EDR tape, checks for error conditions, and reformats the data to generate a CRS encyclopedia tape, which is sent to CalTech for subsequent data analysis.
Note: THIS SOFTWARE IS NOT FOR PUBLIC USE.
Software Name : ENCYCLOPEDIA GENERATOR Software Type : N/A Software Release Date : N/A Node ID : N/A Cognizant Engineer : NAND LAL Software Access Description : N/A
Software 'VCRUSH' ----------------- The VCRUSH program is run at Caltech to select data of interest from CRS encyclopedia tapes. In the case of counting rate data, no further analysis is done to produce the data in the PDS data sets.
Note: THIS SOFTWARE IS NOT FOR PUBLIC USE.
Software Name : VCRUSH Software Type : N/A Software Release Date : N/A Node ID : N/A Cognizant Engineer : THOMAS L. GARRARD Software Access Description : N/A
Data_Set_PDS3.confidence_level_note: Overview ======== Each data point represents a six-second accumulation, so that the statistical uncertainty is obtained according to Poisson statistics by taking the square root of one sixth of the counting rate. However, larger uncertainties are associated with the conversion from counting rate to flux.
